title.narrative: Enhancing the Health System’s Response to COVID-19 in Accommodation Structures for Migrants and Unaccompanied Migrant Children and in COVID-19 Referral Hospitals and Primary Health Centers in Areas with Large Migrant Populations

description.narrative: Greece has been facing a two-fold challenge since the outbreak of the COVID-19 in March 2020, namely the health risks associated with the virus itself, coupled with the broader health and protection risks emerging from the persistent overcrowding within the migrant settings operating in the country (RICs, open accommodation sites, pre-removal centres, UMC facilities). The project seeks to address this challenge by taking urgent measures on two fronts: (a) Reinforcing COVID-19 prevention and response measures within migrant facilities operating in the country by setting up fully equipped mobile units and modular clinics for the treatment of COVID-19 cases in open accommodation sites, pre-removal centres and UMC shelters, creating COVID-19 isolation/quarantine areas in pre-removal centres, providing COVID-19 related medical supplies and medicines for all the mobile units, modular clinics and RICs, and; (b) Reinforcing COVID-19 referral Hospitals and Primary Health Centres located in areas with large migrant populations by providing them with COVID-19 related medical equipment.
